name: SENSELESS CITY: SPACE JESUS Homebrew NES Game
name_original: SENSELESS CITY: SPACE JESUS Homebrew NES Game
description:
TO PLAY:
DIRECTION PAD: MOVES BETWEEN SELECTIONS,  SCROLLS THROUGH LETTERS ON PASSWORD SCREEN
START BUTTON:  STARTS GAME, ENTERS PASSWORD,  MOVES IN AND OUT OF INVENTORY
SELECT BUTTON: SWITCHES BETWEEN GAME START AND PASSWORD SCREEN ON TITLE SCREEN
A BUTTON: SELECTS OPTIONS IN CHOICE MENU, MOVES DIALOG FORWARD
B BUTTON: DOES NOTHING SO FAR

This is my third NES homebrew game, and a sequel of sorts to my second. This is an expansion to the world of SENSELESS CITY, first introduced in the puzzle game I released last year. You can find the first SENSELESS CITY game here:
https://destroyed4com4t.itch.io/senseless-city

It's a visual novel, built around a widely expanded version of Nightendushi's VNES-ENGINE, which I converted to CNROM mapper from the original NROM to be able to add more characters as well as expanding the scripting language to accommodate music and background changes as well as an inventory system. If you wanna try your hand at Nightendushi's original engine, it is here:
https://github.com/NightenDushi/VNES_Engine

It's still very obviously a demo at this point. I expect the finished game to be a 96KB CNROM, which will make it the second one in existence after Bubble Bath Babes, lol. After this I will probably make a crunched down version of the engine with smaller characters and more detailed backgrounds for future games but I just really wanted to stick with the idea of giant characters in this one because they looked so good.
